options.content:
#### üõéÔ∏è Important

This Dashboard is an experimental MongoDB Instance Summary dashboard in Percona Monitoring and Management (PMM) that is not a part of the official PMM deployment and might be updated.
We ship this Dashboard to obtain feedback from our users. Once we officially release this Dashboard, it will be moved to the appropriate folder. 

To provide feedback on the Dashboard, please use [our](https://forums.percona.com) forum.üôè

panels.description: A shard contains a subset of sharded data for a sharded cluster. Together, the cluster‚Äôs shards hold the entire data set for the cluster.
panels.title: QPS of Services in Shard

panels.description: A shard contains a subset of sharded data for a sharded cluster. Together, the cluster‚Äôs shards hold the entire data set for the cluster.
panels.title: Shards

panels.description: When you run removeShard, MongoDB drains the shard by using the balancer to move the shard‚Äôs chunks to other shards in the cluster. Once the shard is drained, MongoDB removes the shard from the cluster.
panels.title: Draining Shards

panels.description: MongoDB stores documents in collections. Collections are analogous to tables in relational databases.
panels.title: Sharded Collections

panels.description: A MongoDB sharded cluster deployment can contain collections that are either unsharded (the default when created) or sharded.
panels.title: Unsharded Collections

panels.description: The MongoDB balancer is a background process that monitors the number of chunks on each shard.
panels.title: Balancer Enabled

panels.description: A chunk consists of a subset of sharded data.
panels.title: Total amount of Chunks

panels.description: This shows the time since the last election.
panels.title: ReplSet Last Election
Chunks distribution
panels.description: Show the chunk distribution between all the shards involved
Ops or Replicated Ops/sec classified by legacy wire protocol type (query, insert, update, delete, getmore). And (from the internal TTL threads) the docs deletes/sec by TTL indexes.

targets.expr: sum by (environment, cluster, legacy_op_type) (rate(mongodb_ss_opcountersRepl{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", rs_nm=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name",legacy_op_type!~"(command|query|getmore)"}[$interval]))

panels.title: Command Operations

panels.description: Show the 5 collections that are most frequently read.
panels.title: Top Hottest Collections by Read

panels.description: Average latency of operations (classified by read, write, or (other) command)

targets.expr: avg by (op_type) (rate(mongodb_ss_opLatencies_latency{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", service_name=~"$service_name"}[$interval]) / (rate(mongodb_ss_opLatencies_ops{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", service_name=~"$service_name"}[$interval]) > 0) or irate(mongodb_ss_opLatencies_latency{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster",service_name=~"$service_name"}[5m]) / (irate(mongodb_ss_opLatencies_ops{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", ervice_name=~"$service_name"}[5m]) > 0))

panels.title: Query execution times

targets.expr: topk (5,sum by (environment,cluster,database,collection) (irate(mongodb_top_insert_count{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", rs_nm=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name"}+mongodb_top_remove_count{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", rs_nm=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name"}+mongodb_top_update_count{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", rs_nm=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name"})[1m]))

panels.description: Ops/sec, classified by legacy wire protocol type (query, insert, update, delete, getmore).

targets.expr:
sum(sum(rate(mongodb_op_counters_total{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", rs_nm=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name", type!="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_op_counters_total{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", rs_nm=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name", type!="command"}[5m])) by (instance) * on (instance) 
group_right mongodb_mongod_replset_my_state{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", set=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name"} / mongodb_mongod_replset_my_state{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", set=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name"}) by (set)

panels.title: Operations Per Shard

panels.description: ReplSet statuses during the select time range.
panels.title: $set Node States
Size of Collections in Shards
panels.description: MongoDB stores documents in collections. Collections are analogous to tables in relational databases.

targets.expr: max by(rs_nm, collection, database) (mongodb_collstats_storageStats_storageSize{cluster=~"$cluster", db!~"admin|config", rs_nm=~"$shard"})

panels.description: MongoDB stores documents in collections. Collections are analogous to tables in relational databases.
panels.title: Number of Collections in Shards

panels.description: TCP connections (Incoming) in mongod processes.

targets.expr: avg by (rs_nm) (mongodb_connections{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", rs_nm=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name", state="current", rs_nm!=""})

panels.title: Current Connections Per Shard

targets.expr: sum by (set) (avg by (service_name,set) (mongodb_connections{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", rs_nm=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name", state="available"}) * on (service_name) group_right avg by (service_name,set) (mongodb_mongod_replset_my_state{environment=~"$environment", cluster=~"$cluster", set=~"$set", service_name=~"$service_name"}/ mongodb_mongod_replset_my_state{cluster="$cluster"}))

panels.description: A chunk consists of a subset of sharded data.
panels.title: Amount of Chunks in Shards

panels.description: The sharding operation creates the initial chunk(s) to cover the entire range of the shard key values. The number of chunks created depends on the configured chunk size. After the initial chunk creation, the balancer migrates these initial chunks across the shards as appropriate as well as manages the chunk distribution going forward.
panels.title: Dynamic of Chunks

panels.description: MongoDB migrates chunks in a sharded cluster to distribute the chunks of a sharded collection evenly among shards.
panels.title: Chunks Move Events

panels.description: MongoDB splits chunks when they grow beyond the configured chunk size. Both inserts and updates can trigger a chunk split.
panels.title: Chunks Split Events

panels.description: Timespan 'window' between oldest and newest ops in the Oplog collection.
panels.title: Oplog Range by Shard
